metadata.title: CVE-2024-25744 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.6.7, an untrusted VMM can trigger int80syscall handling at any given point. This is related toarch/x86/coco/tdx/tdx.c and arch/x86/mm/mem_encrypt_amd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
